front.head: IMPROMPTU, ON HEARING, AS HE WAS RISING IN THE MORNING, OF THE DEATH OF THE REV. JOHN DUNCOMBE, M.A. INSCRIBED TO MRS. DUNCOMBE, OF CANTERBURY.

lg.l: PEACE to the spot where his remains are laid;
May purest bliss await his friendly shade!
Nature by him had done her noblest part:
She gave a head, nor yet denied a heart.
